ygData.subject: Re: New Bard Quests! (long spoilerish)
ygData.msgSnippet: DON T /PETITION IT!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! There are two different groups of people that work on Verant, GMs and Developers.  GMs are there to help you with in-game
ygData.messageBody:
DON'T /PETITION IT!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

There are two different groups of people that work on Verant, GMs and
Developers. GMs are there to help you with in-game problems. They cannot
modify the database or give you a different item. They don't even interact
with Developers. GMs cannot fix this type of problem.

There are /feedback and /bug commands to take care of these types of
problems. These commands will be routed to the Developers who can fix the
problem. Or email your complaints to Verant directly.

When you order pizza delivery, and your pizza is running late, who do you
call? You probably dial 911. Instead, you should think about who can
actually help you with the problem. Call the pizza company.

Why should this matter to us? Well if IDIOTS fill the petition queue with
RETARDED petitions, it takes the GMs longer to handle real petitions. How
would everyone on Innoruuk feel if their petitions took 30 minutes longer to
handle because some IDIOTS felt they could get the database changed by
filling up the petition queue?

I understand your frustrations, but don't frustrate everyone else with your
actions.


Wayne


> Message: 12
> Date: Thu, 07 Oct 1999 10:27:14 -0700
> From: Ryan Honeyman <slasher@...>
> Subject: Re: New Bard Quests! (long spoilerish)
>
>
> WTF????? wis and int? Man I was ripped off, this sucks.
>
> /petition You all messed up again, you gave me cleric type
> armor, what gives? Don't you realize bards primary stats
> are in STR/DEX/AGI/CHA? You probably just typo'd in the
> armor database again, which is fairly typical these days. =)
>
> GM tells you 'Hail, guide Soandso here. I've read your
> petition. And honestly there's nothing I can do, if you
> would file a bug report that would be appreciated'
>
> If Verant does this again, like they did on the PoS, err I
> mean PoF armor (not to mention the pisspoor color) I will
> flood them with feedback/petitions/etc. In fact everytime
> I take a faction hit from someone else's kill, I petition.
> Only the squeaky wheel gets the grease, and typing a message
> in a bug report that is never read gets me more frustrated.
>
> I hate working hard for a crappy reward. That's why I currently
> do no quests (for the ones that actually work). These days in
> Norrath are making this bard bitter =)
>
> Harmonic Distortion, 38th unchained melody.
> League of Antonican Bards, The Wind Spirit's Song
> < Keepers of Norrath > Innoruuk
